intro: Jankaea, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine, velvety hairs. The flowers are typically clustered in racemes and are usually yellow or greenish in color. Jankaea species are native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. They are often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and agricultural fields.
